title: Germany’s Jews Feel ‘Under Siege’ Following Rise in Anti-Semitism
text:
BERLIN—A day after an attack on a synagogue left two dead in Halle, eastern Germany, Jews across the country said they felt increasingly under siege from growing anti-Semitism across German society.

Jewish community leaders had warned for months about a rising number of assaults by recently arrived migrants from the Middle East, Islamists and far-left opponents of Israel. But the Halle attack, which authorities said appeared motivated by far-right ideology, underlined the formidable threat still posed by right-wing extremists...
